    • Method Detail

      • powerOf2

        public static boolean powerOf2(int n)
        Verifies if the integer is a power of two by using the "and" function between the target number "n" and "n-1". If the number is indeed a power of 2 the result will be 0 (this is because the "and" function is actually applied to the binary representation of "n" and "n-1" and if the number is a power of two it will always result in 0), else it is not a power of two.
        Parameters:
        n - target number to verify if it is a power of two
        Returns:
        true if it is a power of two

      • copyNextBNToBlock

        public static void copyNextBNToBlock(VirtualDiskBlock vdb,
                                     int value)
        Writes the index of the next free block on the last four bytes of the block
        Parameters:
        vdb - virtual disk block object
        value - index of next free block

      • copyNodeToBlock

        public static void copyNodeToBlock(VirtualDiskBlock vdb,
                                   int value)
        Writes the index of the specified inode on the block (capacity-5 to capacity-8)
        Parameters:
        vdb - virtual disk block object
        value - index of the inode to write
